verses.kjv: And when the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon, she came to prove Solomon with hard questions at Jerusalem, with a very great company, and camels that bare spices, and gold in abundance, and precious stones: and when she was come to Solomon, she communed with him of all that was in her heart.
verses.ct: When the queen of Sheba heard about Solomon's reputation, she traveled to Jerusalem to test him with difficult questions. She arrived with an enormous entourage, along with camels carrying spices, a huge amount of gold, and precious stones. When she met with Solomon, she discussed with him everything that was on her mind.

verses.kjv: And Solomon told her all her questions: and there was nothing hid from Solomon which he told her not.
verses.ct: Solomon answered every one of her questions. Nothing was too complex for him — he explained it all to her.

verses.kjv: And when the queen of Sheba had seen the wisdom of Solomon, and the house that he had built,
verses.ct: After the queen of Sheba had witnessed Solomon's wisdom, the palace he had constructed,

verses.kjv: And the meat of his table, and the sitting of his servants, and the attendance of his ministers, and their apparel; his cupbearers also, and their apparel; and his ascent by which he went up into the house of the LORD; there was no more spirit in her.
verses.ct: the food served at his table, the seating arrangements for his officials, the service of his attendants and their uniforms, his cupbearers and their uniforms, and the stairway he used to go up to the house of the LORD — she was completely overwhelmed.

verses.kjv: And she said to the king, It was a true report which I heard in mine own land of thine acts, and of thy wisdom:
verses.ct: She told the king, "The report I heard back in my own country about your accomplishments and your wisdom was absolutely true."

verses.kjv: Howbeit I believed not their words, until I came, and mine eyes had seen it: and, behold, the one half of the greatness of thy wisdom was not told me: for thou exceedest the fame that I heard.
verses.ct: "But I didn't believe what people told me until I came here and saw it with my own eyes. In fact, not even half of your great wisdom was described to me — you far surpass the reputation I had heard about."

verses.kjv: Happy are thy men, and happy are these thy servants, which stand continually before thee, and hear thy wisdom.
verses.ct: "How fortunate your people are! How fortunate these servants of yours are, who get to stand in your presence constantly and listen to your wisdom!"

verses.kjv: Blessed be the LORD thy God, which delighted in thee to set thee on his throne, to be king for the LORD thy God: because thy God loved Israel, to establish them for ever, therefore made he thee king over them, to do judgment and justice.
verses.ct: "Praise the LORD your God, who was so pleased with you that he placed you on his throne to rule as king for the LORD your God. Because your God loves Israel and wants to sustain them forever, he made you their king to carry out justice and righteousness."

verses.kjv: And she gave the king an hundred and twenty talents of gold, and of spices great abundance, and precious stones: neither was there any such spice as the queen of Sheba gave king Solomon.
verses.ct: Then she presented the king with 120 talents of gold, an enormous quantity of spices, and precious stones. There had never been spices like the ones the queen of Sheba gave to King Solomon.

verses.kjv: And the servants also of Huram, and the servants of Solomon, which brought gold from Ophir, brought algum trees and precious stones.
verses.ct: Additionally, the servants of Huram and the servants of Solomon who brought gold from Ophir also brought back algum wood and precious stones.

verses.kjv: And the king made of the algum trees terraces to the house of the LORD, and to the king’s palace, and harps and psalteries for singers: and there were none such seen before in the land of Judah.
verses.ct: The king used the algum wood to make terraces for the house of the LORD and for the royal palace, as well as harps and lyres for the musicians. Nothing like them had ever been seen before in the land of Judah.

verses.kjv: And king Solomon gave to the queen of Sheba all her desire, whatsoever she asked, beside that which she had brought unto the king. So she turned, and went away to her own land, she and her servants.
verses.ct: King Solomon gave the queen of Sheba everything she wanted — whatever she requested — in addition to gifts matching what she had brought to him. Then she and her servants left and returned to her own country.

verses.kjv: Now the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred and threescore and six talents of gold;
verses.ct: The total weight of gold that Solomon received in a single year was 666 talents of gold,

verses.kjv: Beside that which chapmen and merchants brought. And all the kings of Arabia and governors of the country brought gold and silver to Solomon.
verses.ct: not counting what the traders and merchants brought in. All the kings of Arabia and the governors of the surrounding regions also brought gold and silver to Solomon.

verses.kjv: And king Solomon made two hundred targets of beaten gold: six hundred shekels of beaten gold went to one target.
verses.ct: King Solomon made 200 large shields of hammered gold, with 600 shekels of hammered gold going into each shield.

verses.kjv: And three hundred shields made he of beaten gold: three hundred shekels of gold went to one shield. And the king put them in the house of the forest of Lebanon.
verses.ct: He also made 300 smaller shields of hammered gold, using 300 shekels of gold for each one. The king placed them in the Palace of the Forest of Lebanon.

verses.kjv: Moreover the king made a great throne of ivory, and overlaid it with pure gold.
verses.ct: The king also constructed a massive throne made of ivory and covered it with pure gold.

verses.kjv: And there were six steps to the throne, with a footstool of gold, which were fastened to the throne, and stays on each side of the sitting place, and two lions standing by the stays:
verses.ct: The throne had 6 steps leading up to it, with a gold footstool attached to it. There were armrests on both sides of the seat, and 2 lions stood beside the armrests.

verses.kjv: And twelve lions stood there on the one side and on the other upon the six steps. There was not the like made in any kingdom.
verses.ct: 12 lions stood on the 6 steps, one on each end of every step. Nothing like it had ever been made for any other kingdom.

verses.kjv: And all the drinking vessels of king Solomon were of gold, and all the vessels of the house of the forest of Lebanon were of pure gold: none were of silver; it was not any thing accounted of in the days of Solomon.
verses.ct: All of King Solomon's drinking cups were made of gold, and every item in the Palace of the Forest of Lebanon was pure gold. Silver wasn't even considered valuable during Solomon's time.

verses.kjv: For the king’s ships went to Tarshish with the servants of Huram: every three years once came the ships of Tarshish bringing gold, and silver, ivory, and apes, and peacocks.
verses.ct: The king had ships that sailed to Tarshish with Huram's crew. Once every 3 years, the Tarshish fleet would return carrying gold, silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks.

verses.kjv: And king Solomon passed all the kings of the earth in riches and wisdom.
verses.ct: King Solomon surpassed every other king on earth in wealth and wisdom.

verses.kjv: And all the kings of the earth sought the presence of Solomon, to hear his wisdom, that God had put in his heart.
verses.ct: Every king on earth wanted an audience with Solomon to hear the wisdom that God had placed in his mind.

verses.kjv: And they brought every man his present, vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and raiment, harness, and spices, horses, and mules, a rate year by year.
verses.ct: Each of them brought gifts year after year — items of silver and gold, clothing, weapons, spices, horses, and mules.

verses.kjv: And Solomon had four thousand stalls for horses and chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen; whom he bestowed in the chariot cities, and with the king at Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Solomon had 4,000 stalls for horses and chariots, and 12,000 horsemen. He stationed them in the chariot cities and with him in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And he reigned over all the kings from the river even unto the land of the Philistines, and to the border of Egypt.
verses.ct: He ruled over all the kings from the Euphrates River all the way to the land of the Philistines and down to the border of Egypt.

verses.kjv: And the king made silver in Jerusalem as stones, and cedar trees made he as the sycomore trees that are in the low plains in abundance.
verses.ct: The king made silver as common as stones in Jerusalem, and cedar wood as plentiful as the sycamore trees growing in the lowlands.

verses.kjv: And they brought unto Solomon horses out of Egypt, and out of all lands.
verses.ct: Horses were imported for Solomon from Egypt and from every other country.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Solomon, first and last, are they not written in the book of Nathan the prophet, and in the prophecy of Ahijah the Shilonite, and in the visions of Iddo the seer against Jeroboam the son of Nebat?
verses.ct: As for the rest of Solomon's activities, from beginning to end, aren't they recorded in the writings of Nathan the prophet, in the prophecy of Ahijah the Shilonite, and in the visions of Iddo the seer concerning Jeroboam son of Nebat?

verses.kjv: And Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel forty years.
verses.ct: Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel for 40 years.

verses.kjv: And Solomon slept with his fathers, and he was buried in the city of David his father: and Rehoboam his son reigned in his stead.
verses.ct: Then Solomon died and joined his ancestors. He was buried in the city of David, his father. His son Rehoboam became king after him.
